question: What do i put in my head element?
answer: A basic head element includes things like page title and description, link to stylesheets and site metadata. For a more in-depth look, check out our head guide.

question: How do I link a file to my html?
answer: If you want to link a file to your html, you should link it either the head or the bottom of the body tag depending on the filetype. For stylesheets you use the link tag in your head tag and set the href to the .css file path. For JavaScript you generally place it at the bottom of the body with a script tag. Make sure you place it inside the body tag. Remember: html will always load the first JS file first, so if you have any libraries or code which depends on other files, make sure you place them in the correct order.

question: Can I copy code from the internet?
answer: Short answer: yes. However, you should understand how the code works before you use it. If you know how it works you have learned something and it will be easier to fix if it happens again. You also need to remember to credit code authors.

question: How do I make a link go to a section on the same page?
answer: You can make a link go to a section on the same page by linking the href in the a tag to an id of another element. For example, if a section has the id information, you can link the a tag to '#information'.

question: Which browser should I use?
answer: That is up to you, but Firefox is know to be the most secure mainstream browser. We don't recommend Google Chrome because of its long history of collecting user data and bad performance. There are many other browsers that use the same platform as Chrome (Chromium), such as Microsoft Edge or Brave browser.

question: How do I link to a YouTube video?
answer: On the YouTube website, under the video, press the share button. You will see an embed option. Copy the code it gives you and put in on your website.
